title: Where are heaven and hell located? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to the Muggletonians heaven is about six miles above the surface of the Earth. They had analysed the Old Testament carefully and reconstructed the old Israellite conception of the universe -  As far as they were concerned the sky was a solid ceiling and heaven lay above it. They issued an edict against ballooning in the early 18th century, warning against bumping into it. Hell is in fact the surface of the Earth after the Day of Judgement, which in their opinion would involve God putting out the sun and stars and everyone being resurrected. They concluded that bodies of people will lay in their graves undisturbed until that day, when the Muggletonians would be transported to heaven leaving the unbelievers behind to suffer in darkness. In the words of Thomas Tomkinson, a leading figure in the sect after the deaths of the prophets Muggleton and Reeve, it’s founders - "in which darkness they shall hear one another's doleful cries and cursed blasphemies, but shall never see one another's dreadful faces; neither can they stir from the place of their resurrection having bodies as heavy as lead and as black as pitch." Pretty grim eh? The Muggletonian interpretation of scripture was never exactly popular, but their Biblical scholarship and research was impeccable in their own opinion at least, and they’d lay a curse on you if you dared suggest they might be a little crack brained. It’s as good an explanation as any I’ve heard from a theologian, and at least the Muggletonian interpretation has the merit of eschewing windy and vague speculation about undetectable ‘spirit realms’ and souls that existed separate from the body and stuck solidly to a materialist interpretation of the Bible. Now where is Valhalla? And where is Hades? And what about the Bardo Thodol and that weird tunnelly bit between incarnations? Or Duat, where Thoth weighs hearts against a feather of Ma’at and feeds those too heavy with cares to Ammit the Devourer of Souls?
